intro: Filetia paniculata, commonly known as the panicled filetia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in paniculate inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Filetia paniculata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
